result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristi L. Meverden

9:02 AM Defendant Kristi L. Meverden in court.  Attorney David Moss in court for Kristi L. Meverden.  Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not resolved.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Phone call from Atty Moss and Jordan/DA's office rescheduled the STC that was set on 7/14/2022 at 9am to 9/15/2022 at 9am. This was rescheduled at the request of Atty Moss - he has not received an offer yet.
Phone call from Atty Moss and Amy/DA's office scheduled STC on 7/14/2022 at 9am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
09:01 AM Defendant Kristi L. Meverden in court with attorney David Moss. Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer not received.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:03 AM Defendant Kristi L. Meverden in court with attorney David Moss.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information received and reviewed.  NG plea entered.  Waive reading.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

w/conditions   Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle AT ALL..  Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/ORH Stay off 200 Block of Ridge Rd.  Maintain 50' Perimeter.    Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.  Supervised contact w/her children only ATM, BRM, DDM.
Defense argues bond motion.  Response by State.  Court amends cash bond.

09:03 AM Defendant Kristi L Meverden in court with attorney David Moss.  Defendant Kristi L Meverden in custody.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    PQW received/reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court.  Arraignment scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:10 AM Defendant Kristi L Meverden in court with attorney David Moss.  Defendant Kristi L Meverden in custody.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint reviewed.  Waive reading.  PH within time limits.  Present bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Victim Statement to Judge regarding bond
